website_summaries.verdict: Well worth the investment, these shoes provide everything you expect, including comfort and style.
pros: Stand-out gel cushioning system optimizes shock absorption
Shoes glow in the dark to maximize nighttime safety
cons: These shoes run 1/2 to 1 size small, and they're fairly expensive

customer_reviews.title: Asics - why ruin a great thing?? Kayano 22+23 are awful.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with many other reviewers - what was Asics thinking? I have been a devout Kayano fan for almost 20 years, and now I need to find a new shoe. The Kayano 22 gave me horrible blood blisters on my toes and heels, and I was hopeful that for the Kayano 23 Asics would go back to the classic Kayano shape and fit - but to no avail. The made the toe box wider than the 22, but now the shoes are short. I'm returning these immediately, ordering a pair of Kayano 21's, and will have to find a new running shoe after 20 years. So bummed!
customer_reviews.author: CC-G

customer_reviews.title: Try them on in store before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Been running in gel kaynos for years. The 23 feels like a design change. They are narrower. My feet hate the 23's. Just did my 2nd run. They are going to goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stability shoe
customer_reviews.text: I knew the toe box width on the Kayano 22 and 23 were not as wide as previous models and I usually wear 1 size larger than my street shoe size 7 so I bought 8 1/2 - 1 1/2 size larger than street shoe size and it was a perfect fit. I've worn the GT2000 prior but the cushion of the Kayano is unbeatable. It is worth the $$. Especially for long runs. Also, the color of the shoes is much more vibrant and stunning than in the photo online.
customer_reviews.author: Linda N.

customer_reviews.title: ... have you done to the sizing which this much loved shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Asics what have you done to the sizing which this much loved shoe!!! I have been wearing Asics Gel Kayanos for 15 years and have never had a problem with the fit. They seem to have made the 23 much smaller. I had read this in previous reviews so ordered a size up but it did not solve this issue. The toe box is just really tight! I have narrow feet and in one size up from my normal Asics size I still found my toes being pinched. After one 50 min run I had blisters and a black toe nail! Asics please go back to your previous sizing! Now I will have to find a new running shoe
customer_reviews.author: Fay Potton

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Love the print and love the cushioning! This is my 3rd pair of Kayanos and I am always impressed. I agree that this version a bit more narrow than my last pair but so far has not been an issue. I wear a 10 medium and ordered a 10 medium. Length seems fine. I have about 1/2 inch at toe, same as last version.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl lewis

customer_reviews.title: Toe box is narrowed on this style numb toes.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Asics Gel Kayano shoes for 2 decades. Asics changed the toe box and made it more narrow. My toes went numb and only after reading reviews for this style did I realize why I couldn't wear them. I ordered the ASICS 24 and the toe box is back to normal. What a waste of money for these shoes. It is an Asics problem. Why narrow a toe box on a running shoe? Who was the genius for this design change?
customer_reviews.author: DuckSoup49

customer_reviews.title: USED shoes.... so GROSS!
customer_reviews.text: I would give a ZERO star if I could! ....Disgusting! First off, I ordered these (Asics) shoes and they came in a Nike box! That should have been my first red flag! Then when I took the shoes out of the box, I noticed the soles were dirty! There were little pebbles in the crevices of the soles! You could see definite wear! And the inside of the shoes were fuzz balls (from socks being worn) and HAIR! So disgustingly gross! I'm pissed because now I have to take time out of my busy schedule to return/ship them and I still don't have a pair of shoes!
customer_reviews.author: mrscarroll

customer_reviews.title: No bueno
customer_reviews.text: It's June 8th. About 90 days after purchasing these and the rubber sole is tearing off the bottom from walking 3-5 miles a day. This hasn't happened before with Asics. I'm very disappointed the return window closed 20 days ago. I would not purchase this specific shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: jake bates

customer_reviews.title: Order a 1/2 up and you will be happy.
customer_reviews.text: I wrote that these shoes fit as expected ONLY because I listened to the reviewers that said to order a 1/2 size larger than what I usually wear. I ordered an 8.5 and they fit just like my size 8 Noosas. I don't feel like the toe box is too narrow... they literally fit like my Noosas did. I have never worn Kayanos before but I really like how squishy the soles feel. Overall I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: These are the best shoes! I recently purchased the newest Asics Kayano ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes! I recently purchased the newest Asics Kayano 24. They were sold to me under the guise they have a layer of Kevlar in them which would extend the life of the shoe from your average 300 miles to 600 miles. I wore the soles down in 260 miles, they wore blisters on my heel, obvious defect in the stitching and did not hold up well at all. I went back to my ol faithful Kayano 23! I had two pair last year preparing for and completing my first full Ironman. Got my new ones last week. So far 30 miles on them and they are PERFECT! Best most comfortable supportive shoe ever!
customer_reviews.author: FosterBoy

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Love love these shoes. I'm flat footed and knock kneed so finding running shoes that are comfortable and supportive has always been a challenge. I ordered half a size up as recommended and they fit perfect. I'm planning on buying another pair for work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered wide - they fit like non-wides - too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was fine, as usual, but I ordered D width. We did indeed receive D width but they fit like they were not. My wife had tried on many Asics (which she wears exclusively) and settled on these. For some reason the Gel-Keyanos fit very narrow but were her favorite. The store didn't have the wider width so Amazon won. Upon arrival they fit exactly like the ones in the store even though I clicked on the wider width (which according to the markings on the shoes we did receive) but they were not any wider than the ones at the store. Returning for a different non-weird fitting Gel-Surveyors
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: First run to break them in, and the weirdest thing happened....
customer_reviews.text: ....Take a look at these photos. Nev er had ANYTHING like this with Asics before. We exclusively run in the Kayanos and Nimbus' and they hold up better than most other running shoes. This is obviously some crazy defect since it happened on the first run (training for marathon) of about 10 miles. Never seen anything like this before, hope to never see anything like this again. I honestly feel terrible rating these shoes so low, but as you can tell from the pictures, I had no choice. Asics is our go to brand, and out of 100's of shoes we've run into the ground....this is just a mystery to us.
customer_reviews.author: BestAmazonReviews

customer_reviews.title: Runs more narrow
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable where I have run fine in them but they are definitely more narrow in the toebox than previous versions.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.Jordan

customer_reviews.title: My feet are in love...
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I'm an RN and my feet take a beating during my shift. I have plantar fasciitis and use a firm orthotic support beneath the insole for added support and my feet remain comfortable throughout the shift. Construction and quality are top shelf.
customer_reviews.author: J. Meredith

customer_reviews.title: FAKE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are fake Chinese knock offs!!!!! I have Asics shoes so I know the quality. When I took them out the box something was off, not like in the picture. The color on the inside of the shoe is a lilac, quilted material. The shoe I received is a screaming pink satin material and the logo is clearly fake. Box says made in China. Shoes are hard as anything. Biggest rip off ever.
customer_reviews.author: Claire O

customer_reviews.title: Why has Asics changed it's toe box? Bye bye to the days where I didn't have to break in a shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Asics for almost the last 2 decades. They seemed to have changed their design the last couple of years to make the toe box more narrow, which is really unfortunate because I started wearing Asics due to the comfort of their wide toe box. I keep hoping the next series will return to their old design. I keep buying their shoes, but have not been happy with them since the Kayano 21 because instead of my feet feeling happy with out a break-in period, I feel the shoes break my feet. I hope with enough people stating what I am saying Asics will get a hint and go back to their original designs.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Great support. Awesome cross training shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes as a cross trainer. I’ve never purchased asics before. I typically like Nike but read great reviews about these on cross training websites. I normally wear a 6 or 6.5 but had to go up to a 7 in these so they run a bit small. I do kickboxing training and these shoes are fantastic. I have slightly weak ankles and plantar fasciitis but have had no issues with these shoes. They are comfortable, provide great support for a wide range of cross training exercises. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Corabel771

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I almost did not get these shoes because of the bad reviews but I am glad that I decided not to listen to them. I am very happy with my purchase and I am having no issues with blisters or the shoes being too big. I work out 6 days a week on my treadmill at a pretty fast pace in these shoes and my feet are doing just fine and the shoes are not showing any wear. Maybe the other reviewers are running marathons and that is why they are having issues but for work out equipment and running errands these shoes are great. I would highly recommend getting a pair. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Them So Much This Is My 4th Pair
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I am not a runner, I am a walker Yes, the 23's are an older model shoe. I bought the 24's and returned them. I tried the 25's and they hurt my feet. The 23's help with my back and sciatica pain. I wear them in the house all day and have a pair for outside. I don't know what I'll do when I can't buy them anymore. I've tried other brand shoes but these are hard to find so I buy them when I see them available They are less stiff and don't hurt my feet like the newer versions of the Kayanos. I've not bought or tried the 26's.
customer_reviews.author: Katanajo

customer_reviews.title: It's a Yes for Me!
customer_reviews.text: First, I absolutely love the color and have received several compliments. As for the running, I've worn them three times putting in seven miles and they are comfortable! They feel supportive, cushiony, and light. I wear a size 6 and always tend to buy my size, and that was just fine this time around as well. I run without socks, so the fit was perfect. If you run with socks, I would suggest that you half-up. Also, if you have wide feet, you may want to half up as well. Happy running!
customer_reviews.author: Kissiah Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Gel Kayano I'm used to
customer_reviews.text: I USUALLY love these shoes. They are definitely 1/2 size smaller than the other models and not as comfy. Don't even notice the gel. Took them out for a walk and feet usually feel great (especially on the first day of wearing the Gel -Kayano) and they feel bruised today. So bummed. Wondering if I got a cheap knock off or something:(
customer_reviews.author: keli

customer_reviews.title: Legit Asics
customer_reviews.text: These are legit Asics Kayano. This is my second pair of 23's. The toe box on the 23's is small so I always have to get an 8.5 even though I wear a 7.5-8 in every other shoe. These shoes allow me to walk miles even though I have very damaged knees. I always recommend them. I've tried other shoes, including other Asics models, and they just don't have the same shock absorbing cushion.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I'm so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I agree, I'm a distance runner and have been wearing asics Kayanos for 12 years. Probably have spent $5,000 on asics kayanos over the years. These don't fit right. I'm on my second pair of 23s (tried to give them a second chance) and having knee problems and discomfort with feet. Why did they have to change the model? I'm so disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Emily H. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great support for flat feet.
customer_reviews.text: My feet are overly pronated-- flat feet. This causes constant stretching of the plantar fascia which leads to inflammation and pain. I suffered from severe pain from plantar fasciitis for several months. I tried multiple brands of corrective shoes and orthotic inserts with no significant relief. A friend from work recommended the Asics Cayano. After reading about it, decided to give it a try. Very comfortable fit and nice look (prefer completely white for work). But most important, the pain finally went away to not return! This is the 4th pair I've purchased. I use them daily for work and for walking 5 miles/day. Thank you Asics for making this model!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 😞 They stretched out a bit and are more comfortable now, but I was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews about this new version fitting small, but I needed a new pair and always wear Kayanos. Unfortunately, the other reviews were right. This model definitely fits different. I've been wearing Kayanos since about the Kayano 10, but this one is significantly more narrow. My first few workouts ended with numb toes. 😞 They stretched out a bit and are more comfortable now, but I was disappointed. Not disappointed enough to switch shoes, but consistency has always been a selling point with these. Definitely buy a size up (I did and they were still tight). Color and quality are great as always.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Go up a half size
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10 but ordered up a half size to 10.5 after the first pair felt too snug, especially the width. Asics quality is definately not what it used to be and although it fits fine now, the arch support is not wonderful. And that's exactly why you buy Asics - for the support and stabilization. For $100+ I will be looking for another go-to brand. Very sad that I am looking elsewhere after being a faithful customer after 20+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but order one size up!
customer_reviews.text: I went to an outlet store to try these on first but they didn’t carry any women’s 12 in the store, so I had to try the men’s sizes to see if I would like them. They seemed to run small in the men’s but I couldn’t tell if the women’s sizing would be the same, so I ordered my usual size, a 12. These shoes in 12 were way too small (I have shoes in other brands in 12 that fit or are sometimes too big). Luckily these also have them in 13. They are very comfortable once you get the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: You've lost my business!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Asics Gel-Kayano for over 15 years. I liked the extra support and the wide toe box. They last a long time and I'd buy new ones about every 6-8 months. They are expensive, but worth it. The last couple of pairs I bought, same exact shoe, have been narrower in the toe box and cause blisters on my pinkie toe. I tried going up a size but, had the same problem. Asics, why did you change the best sneaker you made? Now, I have to start all over to find a new brand. You lost my business!
customer_reviews.author: June H.

customer_reviews.title: after going for 2 mile walk my knees and ankles hurt so bad that I waited a week and tried again with ...
customer_reviews.text: Unable to wear, after going for 2 mile walk my knees and ankles hurt so bad that I waited a week and tried again with the same results. Tried 3 times and realize it is not worth the pain to try and wear these Kayano's. I am upset, I have wore this shoe for years and now they changed the shoe with the 23 Model. Did not know that I had a 30 return window, so here I am with shoes I can not wear and I am out the money. Unable to talk to anyone at Amazon, all automated, don't like that at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a marathon runner who has been a fan of Kayanos for years. In fact I have worn them exclusively for at least 10 years. However, the 23s have a completely different fit. The base is all over narrower and they seem less like the stability shoe I know and love. The toe box is also much shorter. I have always gone a half size up in running shoes, and do the heel lock, to avoid black toenails, so size isn't the issue. Ugh. I love my asics and am sad that they have changed. Now to begin the hunt for something to replace them with.
customer_reviews.author: Kari M.

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes
customer_reviews.text: Shoe comfort preferences are so personal. Kayano 23s are my favorite - supportive, cushioned, good balance, fit as expected - no complaints. I had some issues with 25s, but I've gone through 2 or 3 pairs of the 23s, and they were all fantastic. That said, some reviewers talk about how awful the 23s are and how happy they are with the 25s. If it's possible for you to try on before buying, I'd recommend that you do so.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous arch support for heel pain.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 9th pair of ASICS kayano. They’ve been my go-to shoes for my busy days. They support the arch which is the only thing that allows me to walk some days. The heel support is fantastic too. This particular set seem slightly shorter in the toe than previous years. Still a great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent shoe for overpronators
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a pair of these shoes bought from my local running store, but as a competitive runner, I try to have multiple pairs of shoes at a time to rotate through them and minimize stress on my joints. This is an excellent shoe for overpronators, you can feel the cushion in the shoe as you run. I don't recommend choosing your shoe online, get yourself fitted in a proper running store, and then if you want you can buy that shoe online (or in the store! Support local running stores!). The shoes arrived on time in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too tight in toe area
customer_reviews.text: I loved the color and the gel for comfort, but across the toe area it was way too tight and cut into the toes and left marks. I ordered the wide width and expected to have a lot more room in the toe area. I think this could have been a very comfortable shoe if you had more room in the toe area. Very disappointed after I put them on and impossible to wear comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Magee

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are off
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was too small. I sent it back. I have the tracking number, but I didn't get an email confirming it like I usually do. Amazon sent me an email and said they will refund when they get it and talk to the 3rd party seller. I'm worried that something went wrong. I guess we will see. I had the gel-kayano from a few years ago. I loved it! The 7s were too big and the 6.5 too tight. Just didn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Duchess

customer_reviews.title: They run small, great running shoe with great stability!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn these for some time, and am pleasantly surprised how much I like them compared to what I was wearing in between. The give my feet great stability and are very well cushioned for shock absorption. They are sturdy and I like the way they look and fit better than the new knit look and fit running shoes have these days They DO RUN A BIT SMALL THOUGH. Order 1/2 a size up. I would recommend to a friend who is looking for a sturdy running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: ” Once I got past that hump they were back to the reliable comfortable ASICS I know and love
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse I’m on my feet for 12+ hours a day and ASICS are the only shoes I swear by. For about 10 years now I know I can count on them leaving me without sore feet at the end of the day. However, this particular pair seemed to run more narrow than normal. My feet hurt for at least 3 weeks while I “broke them in.” Once I got past that hump they were back to the reliable comfortable ASICS I know and love. For reference I’m 5’8” and wear a size 10.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea S.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Shoe Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They do run 1/2 size small but they are returnable and so I returned mine and got 1/2 bigger and they fit great. Very pleased. My podiatrist recommended this kayana Asic for me. I have had plantar fracitious in the past and these shoes are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Overcash

customer_reviews.title: A high-quality running shoe with good support.
customer_reviews.text: Really great running shoes. I've been wearing Asics for years. The gel support through the toe really makes a difference. I run daily and each pair will last about a year. I always buy a size bigger than I wear in regular shoes because a shoe salesperson told me that once and it's always worked out well for me with my Asics.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian R

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like putting on cushions initially, but felt like they were suffocating my feet during my first run. I finally loosened them enough for comfort and then a new problem developed. I do all types of training using a variety of sneakers so these were strictly used for my approximate weekly medium length runs. I have only used my sneakers about a dozen times since purchasing in April 2018. The rubber grip on the sole is coming apart from the shoe. I typically enjoy Asics but this was not a well made shoe. It was out of the 30 day window to get a refund, so I'm stuck with shoes that are no good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: which I miss terribly. Cushion on the shoe is still solid
customer_reviews.text: A more narrow shoe, I have to be careful when I lace up. The 22 series give a much wider toe box, which I miss terribly. Cushion on the shoe is still solid, but again not as comfortable as the 22. I did like the heel grip feature, my foot stays in the shoe no matter what my gait is. Overall a good running shoe, if you do more distance, I would certainly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Rumiko

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable running shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. Asics finally nailed a running shoe. I've always liked Asics better than other brands for running/walking but they have outdone themselves with this shoe. I have the Gel Kayano 22 and while I liked them OK, that pair did rub my achilles area a bit. They have fixed that problem with this version. They are perfect. If in doubt, order up 1/2 size. I've done that with Asics for years, they seem to run a tad small.
customer_reviews.author: Brendaprays

customer_reviews.title: great shoe that doesn't fit anymore
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Asics for years because they run narrow . However, the more recent offerings have been too wide for me. The Kayono 23 is the last year that almost fit! Unfortunately, they no longer make narrows in my size, so I'll have to start looking elsewhere. Otherwise, a good stable, comfortable running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: JeanD

customer_reviews.title: Too small!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted it to work, but it didn't! It runs both small and narrow. I usually wear New Balance stability shoes, but wanted to try this as a recommendation. I read the reviews, and went 1/2 size up, but was way too small and very narrow. As of now, going to stick with New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: CMA

customer_reviews.title: With that being said once I got them I thought they fit perfect. Yes
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews about this new shoe so I knew there were changes in the toe box. The toe box is a little narrower than the previous model therefore you probably need to order one size larger. With that being said once I got them I thought they fit perfect. Yes, they are slightly narrower but not bad at all. The comfort of the overall shoe is the same so I haven't had any issues using these as my new running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Biught 6 months ago.  Excellent fit, support, and durability!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 6 months ago so this is a true testament of fit and durability! I generally buy new shoes every 6 months for proper foot and back health. Ordered another pair today! Best fitting and supportive athletic shoe I’ve ever had! It’s difficult to find a fit that is also supportive. Athletic shoes are often too narrow for me and I have difficulty finding an effective fit. I work as a Critical Care nurse, 13 hour shifts on my feet, and these shoes have impressed me more than all others. Worth the $. I’m also a very active person every day, and these shoes have earned 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ronicamaki

customer_reviews.title: Supportive for bunny feet
customer_reviews.text: Flat-footed bunny feet person here. I love to walk and have been searching for a mid-grade shoe brand to support my arches (and therefore my back) when walking. I go on walks in a hilly area where the incline can be up to 40 degrees. With other shoes including Brooks, I was experiencing low back strain even after stretching. These shoes solve that issue. They're lightweight, not clunky. Extremely comfortable, even with thick socks. They're stylish and not "grandma" shoes. Love them. I've tried about 8 brands and always come back to Asics.
customer_reviews.author: eeebrrr

customer_reviews.title: Heaven for my Feet!!!
customer_reviews.text: WONDERFUL shoes—heaven for my feet!!! This is my 6th or 7th pair of Asics Kayanos (over the years); no other shoe compares for cushion and support with room without crowding my toes. I HIGHLY recommend them, and this color scheme is really fun, too!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina L. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Worn and useless after only 3 months of limited wear!
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of ASICS and I’m totally disappointed!! Shoes only used when walking for fitness....never worn casually. I walk 3-4 times a week, mostly outside on sidewalk and on indoor track when it rains. After barely 3 months of wear....the forefront of foot is totally worn (see pic) through outer layer of cushion. Began sliding on indoor track (very dangerous)!!! This is how I detected wear. I submitted pics and feedback directly to ASICS and haven’t received so much as an auto reply!! The fit and feel initially were great which is why this is such a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Billups

customer_reviews.title: Running in ASICS Kayano's for over 12 years
customer_reviews.text: I always order a half size up. I am a size 8 in all other shoes but when I order running sneakers I always go a half size up. I have been running in ASCICS Kayano's for about 12 years and purchase about 3 pair a year depending upon race schedule. These have the right amount of cushioning and support I need. I am 5'4, 128lbs with high arches and have had limited overuse ailments which I attribute to these sneakers and knowing when they need to be replaced. If you are a mid to long distance runner I recommend theses sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. Despite some of the negative reviews, I think they fit perfectly. They're really attractive and have alot of support, but they're so light that it's like getting to run barefoot but without the pain. I almost didn't buy a pair of Gel-Kayano 23 because of some of the reviews, even though I have them for the last several years. I waited until the price came down and am very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fun design, great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I wear either Nimbus or Kayano shoes. I turn to,the Kayanos if I want a little more stability. I personally like the designs on the shoes so when I saw these I bought them. I like them well enough I bought the other color. At this price they are a steal. I wear the same size in the Kayanos as I do the Nimbus. I size 1/2 up in the running shoes. I am not a runner but a walker.
customer_reviews.author: Cassiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Yes, too narrow but yes, still the best!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone is right about these! They are so narrow! I have always thought I had pretty narrow feet. I ordered these one full size up and they still feel pretty snug in the toes. Not painful, as the toe area is soft and flexible, but still too snug. I am hoping they'll stretch a bit with time as shoes tend to do. They're very comfortable as always, and offer the best support of any sneaker out there. The colors and designs offered are very cute also.
customer_reviews.author: MXH13

customer_reviews.title: Great for long hours running or standing
customer_reviews.text: I work as an ER nurse and I love these shoes. I have to run or stand for hours at a time, these work great for me! The shoes do feel heavier than the average sneaker. However, they make it up in the arch support. My feet don’t feel as heavy after a shift like they do with another pair of sneakers I used to use. They also saved me from slipping the other night when the floor was wet.
customer_reviews.author: Gisselle

customer_reviews.title: This is the only brand and style I get.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a nurse and early on in my career my feet killed. Then I developed planters fasciitis and my feet really KILLED!!! I was told by some coworker's that these help with foot pain. Got them and fell in love with the immediately! Now for 6 years this is all that I wear at work. Each year I buy new ones for work. To me the price is worth it. Can't put a price on comfortable feet.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney

customer_reviews.title: I TOLD MY WIFE THE FIT WOULD BE JUST RIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: Actually, the shoes arrived a little early, which wasn't a bad thing. My wife wasn't sure about the size she needed so, we went with the size six. They fit perfectly, just like all Asics I have ordered online. The most important thing, besides the perfect fit, was that she loved them.
customer_reviews.author: John Greg McAninch

customer_reviews.title: Great Cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I have been wearing this style for a long time and can’t wear any others. I have foot issues and the cushioning in this shoe beats all the others. Thanks ASICS
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Glad I can order shoes when I need them without ...
customer_reviews.text: Glad I can order shoes when I need them without having to go shopping. I ordered the coral and they are actually a neon color. I wish they were actually the color advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: These made my toes hurt....
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because friend suggested the brand. I wish I tried these sooner so I could return them. Left them in original box because my old running shoes were still good. Just recently tried running in them. These gave me a black toenail after the first time. I rested for a few weeks and tried them again, still made my toes hurt. I wear size 5, my other size 5 shoes never did this to me...Not gonna wear them again....
customer_reviews.author: Jamie651

customer_reviews.title: Good for narrow feet I guess...
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Kayano's for years, same size, same model. My foot is a perfect 7, not wide and not narrow. I buy almost all my shoes online without trying on first in store and they always fit - but as other reviewers stated, the toe box on this shoe is too narrow and is painful. The shoe looks great, good quality, but I'm returning these because I literally can't wear them for very long without being in pain. Hoping Asics goes back to the normal toe box sizing.
customer_reviews.author: A&Y

customer_reviews.title: Wide shoe is very narrow
customer_reviews.text: My foot is big but it's in proportion and I've never needed to order a wide shoe before. I really liked this shoe and it was only available in my size in the Wide so I bought it. I am so surprised at how narrow it fits. My feet are going numb when I'm in cycle class wearing these. Hopefully they will stretch out with use but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Raewyn

customer_reviews.title: This is the first Asics that I used that I don't recommend at all
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Asic's running shoes for more than 14 years. This is the first Asics that I used that I don't recommend at all. Although my feet are narrow this shoes didn't fit comfortable. If you like something comfortable to run many miles chose another one. Do not buy this one!!!! I regret my purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Caminha

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe with Support
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Asics running shoes, I seem to go back and forth between the Kayanos and the GT-2000. These definitely did not disappoint, I love the flower design. I have had them about 2 weeks, I put about 40 miles on them, I like to alternate with my old pair when I am breaking in a new pair. I have not experienced any aches or pains durung the breakin process.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with the style
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy this brand and shoe type but these didn’t work out. Since using these I have developed all kinds of problems like pain in my knees and feet. Somehow these shoes make your feet hurt just standing in thrm for too long! Now I am in physicsl therapy because of it!
customer_reviews.author: sanibel

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed:(
customer_reviews.text: I had three previous pairs of Kayano 22, but the 23s are not up to par. What happen to the forefoot cushioning? I went for a short run, boy I noticed the difference right away. My feet started to hurt so bad I had to stop and walk the rest of the way home:( I even noticed the laces were shorter but that is an easy fix. I hope the 24s are better or I’m going to check out Hoka One One Gavita.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: and their remodel is not good. I need a larger size
customer_reviews.text: I've worn kayanos for 20 years, and their remodel is not good. I need a larger size, there is insufficient padding under the laces and the mesh on the toe box isn't supportive enough. I miss my kayanos 19's. I will be lookong for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Tight through middle
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe, but is tight through middle due to strap added in design change on the 23 that isn't in the 22 or 24, at least from what I've read, but do your research. I'm a medium width and would say if your foot runs on the wider side of medium width, you might find it too tight. Otherwise, good sneaker for me since I'm wearing to gym and not running, so don't think will be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: I love the look of these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these shoes. They did feel like they cut the circulation off my toes for the first few weeks until they stretched. The shoe was a good size with room infront of my toes but still they were tight (I do not have big fits width wise either). I hope the company fixes this problem with future production. I read about that problem in the comments before purchasing, but I still took a chance as I've heard Asic shoes are very supportive shoes. I am very happy with my purchase but it did take a few weeks of discomfort to get there.
customer_reviews.author: Jennyh

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.text: I've previously run in the Gel-Noosa shoes, but needed more support. These look and feel very much like the Gel-Noosas, but with that extra support, though still relatively lightweight. I've been running in these for about 2 months now, and haven't triggered any of the foot issues I tend to have at times (PF, extensor tendonitis, etc.) And I'm VERY happy about that. I do always order a size 'up', tho, as I've found that Asics always run small. Also, these are super cute and colorful; I've gotten quite a few compliments on them!
customer_reviews.author: S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't compare!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to asics a couple of years ago after an injury to my si joint. I was sold on the shoe and this was mys 4th purchase of an asics shoe. Although the shoes are indeed sharp looking, they dont compare to asics ive purchased at all in the past. The toebox in these things is ridiculously narrow and i dont have wide feet. I liked those gt1000 5 model best. These actually really suck.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but ran small
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Gel Kayano's forever, and I had these exact same shoes a couple years ago. I loved the print and was really bummed when they changed the colors, so I was really excited to find some in the floral again. However, they were too small even though I ordered the same size as the ones I already had. Don't know what happened there. They're great running shoes, but they generally run small and this particular pair ran even smaller. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Love love love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these shoes! I am flat foot and these feel the best for me. I tried them on in-store, then did as usual, checked online for a cheaper price. I needed them ASAP, so I paid for overnight shipping, which arrived on time! And I still save about $25 then purchasing in store the day before. Asics always works best for me... the KAYANO 23's are my fit!
customer_reviews.author: The Crown One

customer_reviews.title: ... foot into an asics running shoe and it felt like you were on a soft cloud and you're feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Remember when you slipped your foot into an asics running shoe and it felt like you were on a soft cloud and you're feet were in heaven. Gotta say that has not happened in a while. 😐 Now that lovely toe space is gone. I thought maybe the last pair was just off, so I tried again. Seriously a cheaper shoe, but more expensive than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Sent Back Narrow, Re-Ordered Medium
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Asics Kayano or Nimbus for years. My feet are on the narrow side so when I can get 2A I will order them as I prefer the fit over a medium. So I was pretty surprised that this pair were too narrow, particularly on my left foot, little toe. I sent them back and ordered a medium. The shoe itself looks like it will be great like the other Kayanos.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for a narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great for someone with a narrow foot and an even narrower heel. They fit well from the first day--no need to break them in. This is my third pair in the Gel-Kayano series. I tried Brooks but came back to these. White wasn't my first choice for color but the price was right .
customer_reviews.author: Art Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great for running, bad knees, and supination! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I love these running shoes. I'm still a relatively new runner. I have issues with my knees and I was looking for supportive and comfortable shoes that would make running less painful for me. After doing a lot of research, these were the shoes that had the highest reviews for my knee issues and supination (walk/run on the outsides of my feet). I have a wide foot (8.5W) but I know to order non-wides in a 9.5 and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BAB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for everyday use at work in healthcare. Most uncomfortable sneakers I’ve ever worn and I always by ASICS. They are the same size I always wear. I probably should have returned them for a half size up but it wasn’t available. I get foot cramps and actually take them off for a rest on my break. Very disappointed. They also make a lot of noise when I walk. Sneakers usually don’t do that. I bought a different style ASICS and they fit like a glove. Same size.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof2

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in the ASICS Gel-Kayano shoe since 2006 for my first marathon - almost 12 years. I can usually take them right out of the box new and run a marathon. I run in nothing else - including trail running. I qualified for Boston and ran at Boston in the Asics Gel Kayano. These are too small. The toe box is not the same as previous models. It's a shame because I love the design and finally they have a feminine-looking shoe whose design is actually pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: They feel fine to walk around in but any sort of activity ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the asics kayano shoes for over 15 years. These have been my go to shoes year after year. I read he reviews about them being smaller and tighter but I couldn't bring myself to try another show. I ordered my normal size 8.5 and a 9. My feet were going numb in the 8.5 so I went with the 9. They feel fine to walk around in but any sort of activity my feet feel pressure as they are skinnier. I gave them 2 stars because of the color....so cute but I will never buy them again. So sad....
customer_reviews.author: Alison Moore

customer_reviews.title: I have run in Gel-Kayano for many years. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have run in Gel-Kayano for many years. I ordered this model in the size I have always worn (9.5) and it was to small. I then ordered a size 10 and the length was correct but Asics has redesigned the shoe and the toe box is very narrow now. I won't be purchasing this shoe anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Photo nut

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Kaynos best as they stabalize my feet
customer_reviews.text: ASICS fit my feet perfectly so they are always my choice in a tennis shoe. I really like the Kaynos best as they stabalize my feet. If you find a good solid shoe like I have, stick with it! The size is true and the best for me is that a few styles they have in narrow or double A and I always purchase them because I cannot wear a wider shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Buy a 1/2 size larger than you would normally wear. Runs a bit tight in toe box
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these because of a review that I saw on line. Not sure if I would buy these again. The toe box is very narrow and tight and had to spend some time trying to break them in. Im beyond spending 100.00 to break items in. I only wish I had known that I would have purchased a half size larger to fix that. Will not wear them running as we all know your feet swell when you run. The heel fits great and I do love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support--
customer_reviews.text: These shoes would be excellent except that I read reviews and ordered a size up--received and way too large plus too wide. I have since ordered a full size smaller and have my fingers crossed that they will fit. These were not too narrow on me at all, as other reviews stated.--I usually wear a 91/2 B, for reference. These seem like they will be great exercise shoes once I get the correct size; really good arch support.
customer_reviews.author: DDF

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had posted a while ago how I haven't found a better pair of shoes. Now I can't wear them. The 2 new pairs, both 22's, hurt my feet so much with walking. My daughter says the same thing with hers. My first pair was so awesome, I bought 2 more for me, 1 for my daughter, and one for my son. I am very disappointed since the shoes aren't cheap and just sit around not being worn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up in length and width!
customer_reviews.text: For athletic shoes, I normally buy a size larger than my usual shoe size. I’ve purchased Kayano 22s in a size 9 and these have been my favorite shoes! I stumbled on this pair of Kayano 23s in my same size 9s and was excited to get such a great prime day deal! However, the toe box was very narrow and snug. Ended up exchanging for a size 9D (which was still a tad snug), then finally settled for a 9-1/2D. This size seemed to solve the narrow toe box issue. Despite having to purchase a size up in length and width, I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are super cute but they are not the same fit as ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are super cute but they are not the same fit as my previous gel kayanos. I have worn this style for 20 years, approximately purchased 16 pairs, and this is the first pair that are super narrow and didn’t seem to have the same arch support or stabilization. Bummer 😔
customer_reviews.author: Deederdun

customer_reviews.title: Not the usual fit at all!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear my Kayano's a full size larger. These shoes have not been made in the usual quality. They're shorter and also not as wide at the top of the foot. The changes have caused extreme foot pain and heal pain. I cannot wear them anymore at all. I'm extremely disappointed, I've worn Gel Kayanos for at least 10 years and the quality of these shoes is definitely NOT the same. Not sure if I'll ever buy them again!!
customer_reviews.author: Penny E.

customer_reviews.title: Total Crap!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes because of such favorable reviews from running and fitness websites. I had ordered Asics running shoes in the past and they did not hold up well. I run/workout 5 days a week, and the shoes had broken down within a month of purchase. I decided to try another pair and ordered these. Within two months of similar wear to the previous pair, the glue connecting the treads wore off. The upper part of the shoe shows very little wear and the treads are barely even dirty. I am extremely disappointed in these shoes and the Asics brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Showers

customer_reviews.title: ) but the fit is perfect. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps a bit less cushy than my previous Gel-Kayano's but barely. They do the job and fit is same as previous versions. In regular shoes I'm a 9.5 or a 10. In my ASICS I have always sized up a half until I bought the Gel-Kayanos where I read to go up a size. I bought an 11 (yikes!) but the fit is perfect. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: mom of  Imogen

customer_reviews.title: Been running for 5 years. Tried many different brands ...
customer_reviews.text: Been running for 5 years. Tried many different brands of running shoes to combat plantar fasciitis. I thought my search was over when I tried Asics Gel-Kayano 23s (purchased from a running store). They allowed me to run pain free- no plantar fasciitis. I thought that I could save some money and buy the same make and model online and have the same running experience. I was wrong. I have had foot pain ever since I started running in these a month and a half ago. I have tried inserts and insoles but nothing is helping. What's up with that?! It is very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent running/jogging/walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: excellent running/jogging/walking shoe. Loving it from the first day. I do agree, they are a bit narrow on the front, but Ive been wearing them consistently and they stretched a bit. I got the grey/pink combo, love it. not too loud, a good balance of color. would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: aboura

customer_reviews.title: Size is bit smaller than other ASICS  I used to wear
customer_reviews.text: I love ASICS running shoes. I have worn Noosa series last 5 years as well as my kids. This time I bought Kayano instead of Noosa because I did not like new NoosaDesign. Since I do not have high arches, this shoes is very comfortable on my sole and heel. However the size seems little small amd tight. I normally wear size 7.5 for sleeper and 8 for boots and sneakers to have some room. This Kayano size 8B is little tight and small fit. Otherwise it is great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: AthletsMom

customer_reviews.title: I love it👌
customer_reviews.text: Not much can be said about this ASICS KAYANO 23 size (8) obviously I love the ASICS brand they have a variety of colors real comfortable to wear shoes..feels like walking on clouds I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yahsim

customer_reviews.title: They run small- Too tight on the ankle and heel area..
customer_reviews.text: These are cute sneakers but they run small. My size in different kind of shoes including sneakers are from 6 1/2 to 7. I decided to get size 7 in wide, but to my surprise they were small. Toe box was fine, but I bought then in wide. I got an awful pain in my arch and ankle after wearing them for 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Runs too SMALL
customer_reviews.text: I have always worn a size 7 Asics sneaker but this pair was too small at the toe. My toes were rubbing at the tip of the sneaker. Either this pair runs small or the size was incorrect on the shoe. I loved the colors of this sneaker though!!
customer_reviews.author: SJL

customer_reviews.title: Problems with new version of the Kayano.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing Kayano’s for 16 years and for some reason this new update on the shoe is different for me than the past Kayano’s. The shoe rubs on my ankle bone until it’s raw and bleeding so I had to stop wearing them after 3 uses. I tried to put heal inserts in to raise my heel after my foot healed but it happened again unfortunately. I go through 4-5 pairs a year and this is the first time this has happened. So now I’m searching for Kayano 22’s and older, no problem with those. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C.

customer_reviews.title: Too small but cute
customer_reviews.text: I love Asics and these just did not feel good. Very cute as far as the looks. Love the colors and flowers on these shoes. I wore them around the house for no more than 15 mins and I had to take them off. They were so tight in the toe region that my toes were going numb. Never had that issue with Asics before but I have read that the new Asics are running small and stiffer than the old Asics. Ended up returning these and buying a pair of Brooks which I am very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: The new size 11
customer_reviews.text: Either my foot is growing, or asics has made their 11.5 the size of their previous 11. Been wearing them for years, without fail. Bought a size up this time. As of recent the 11's don't fit anymore. It's perfect. My only complaint is that the picture shows the show as a dark grey but it arrived a deep blue. Oh well. If it fits, I'm not too picky. Wicked comfortable shoe!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S Friedburg

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Kayano, very uncomfortable, won’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never written a negative review yet after wearing ASICS running shoes on and off for 15 years I am very disappointed with these. First I ordered a pair of gt 2000, and they were so uncomfortable I returned them and bought these kayanos knowing how awesome they are...well not anymore. I’ve ran in them 6 times and they are actually getting more uncomfortable! I’m very surprised and disappointed, my feet actually ache while I run and now I’m stuck with them. ASICS, I’m sad to say I will never buy your running shoes again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ASICS Women's Gel-Kayano 23 Running Shoe
product_meta.description:
The gel-kayano 23 shoe features our revolutionary flytefoam technology for the optimal balance of lightweight cushioning comfort for a luxurious ride. The fluid fit upper leverages seamless stretch mesh reinforcements to increase forefoot support, while adapting to the foot's natural motion to create a custom sock-like fit. Our forefoot and Rearfoot gel cushioning systems absorb shock upon impact to equip overpronators with a smooth and effortless transition between heel strike and toe-off phases.

In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.
feature_bullets: Mpact Guidance System (I.G.S) (Running) : ASICS design philosophy that employs linked componentry to enhance the foot's natural gait from heel strike to toe-off
FluidRide: FluidRide  provides the ultimate combination of bounce back and cushioning properties with reduced weight and exceptional durability
FluidFit:  ASICS FluidFit upper technology combines multi-directional stretch mesh with stretch reinforcements that adapt to the athlete's foot, creating a truly customized glove-like fit

Heel Clutching System Technology: Exoskeletal heel counter provides improved support and creates improved heel fitting environment..With improved fit, the new shape not only holds your heel better, it holds the entire foot better while providing superior toe spring.
Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement on multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle
